Kareem has a limited weekly income of $18, and he spends it all on Good X and cereal. Assume the price of Good X is $2 per unit and the price of cereal is $4 per unit.

(a) Given his weekly income, would Kareem be able to buy 3 units of Good X and 5 units of cereal? Explain using numbers.

(b) Calculate the total consumer surplus from Good X if Kareem consumes 4 units of Good X. Show your work.

(c) Identify the quantity of Good X and the quantity of cereal that will maximize Kareem’s total benefit given his weekly income. Explain using marginal analysis.

(d) Assume Good X is produced in a perfectly competitive market and that there is a decrease in the number of consumers in the market for Good X.(i) Will the quantity of Good X that will maximize Kareem’s total benefit increase, decrease, or stay the same? Explain.(ii) Would Kareem’s total consumer surplus from Good X if he consumes 4 units of Good X increase, decrease, or stay the same compared to your answer in part (b) ? Explain.
